21 Download {#download}
22 ========
23 bgpstream 1.0.0 can be downloaded [here](http://www.caida.org/~chiara/bgpstream-doc/bgpstream-1.0.0.tar.gz).
24 
25 
26 
27 Quick Start {#qstart}
28 ===========
29 
30 <!---
31 If you want to just dive right in and get started using BGP Stream, take a look at
32 the \ref quickstart "Quick Start" guide.
33 -->
34 
35 In order to install bgpstream you need to follow the list of instructions below:
36 
37 
38  $ ./configure
39  $ make
40  $ make check
41  $ (sudo) make install
42 
43 
44 Use the --prefix option to install bgpstream and bgpreader in a local directory.
45 
46 The procedure above builds and installs:
47 - the *bgpstream* library
48 - the *bgpreader* tool
49 
50 If you are interested in installing the python bindings, then continue
51 the installation following the instructions [here](http://www.caida.org/~chiara/bgpstream-doc/pybgpstream/install.html).
52 
53 The distribution contains a python tool for the rapid
54 creation/population of an sqlite database. The script is located in
55 the *tools* folder, for more information run:
56 
57  python tools/bgpstream_sqlite_mgmt.py -h
58 
59 
60 Dependencies {#dependencies}
61 ============
62 
63 BGP Stream is written in C and should compile with any ANSI compliant C Compiler
64 which supports the C99 standard. Please email bgpstream-info@caida.org with any
65 issues.
66 
67 Building BGP Stream requires:
68 - [libtrace](http://research.wand.net.nz/software/libtrace.php)
69 version 3.0.14 or higher
70  - a working version of libtrace is available at http://research.wand.net.nz/software/libtrace/libtrace-3.0.22.tar.bz2
71 
72 - [sqlite3](https://www.sqlite.org/) c library
73  - a working version of sqlite3 is available at https://www.sqlite.org/2015/sqlite-autoconf-3081002.tar.gz
74 
75 - [mysql](https://www.mysql.com/) c library, version 5.5 or higher
76  - a working version of mysql is available at http://downloads.mysql.com/archives/get/file/mysql-connector-c-6.1.5-src.tar.gz
77 
78 If the above libraries are not in the system library paths, then you
79 can specify their paths at configuration time:
80 
81  $ ./configure CPPFLAGS='-I/path_to_libs/include' LDFLAGS='-L/path_to_libs/lib'
82 
83 
84 
85 bgpreader tool usage {#usage}
86 ===============
87 bgp reader is a command line tool that prints to standard output
88 information about a bgp stream.
89 
90  usage: bgpreader -d <interface> [<options>]
91 
92  -d <interface> use the given data interface to find available data
93  available data interfaces are:
94  singlefile Read a single mrt data file (a RIB and/or an update)
95  csvfile Retrieve metadata information from a csv file
96  sqlite Retrieve metadata information from a sqlite database
97  mysql Retrieve metadata information from the bgparchive mysql database
98 
99  -o <option-name,option-value>* set an option for the current data interface.
100  use '-o ?' to get a list of available
101  options for the current data interface.
102  (data interface must be selected using -d)
103  -P <project> process records from only the given project (routeviews, ris)*
104  -C <collector> process records from only the given collector*
105  -T <type> process records with only the given type (ribs, updates)*
106  -W <start,end> process records only within the given time window*
107  -R <period> process a rib files every <period> seconds (bgp time)
108  -b make blocking requests for BGP records
109  allows bgpstream to be used to process data in real-time
110  -r print info for each BGP record (in bgpstream format) [default]
111  -m print info for each BGP valid record (in bgpdump -m format)
112  -e print info for each element of a valid BGP record
113  -h print this help menu
114  * denotes an option that can be given multiple times
115 
116  Data interface options for 'singlefile':
117  rib-file rib mrt file to read (default: not-set)
118  upd-file updates mrt file to read (default: not-set)
119 
120  Data interface options for 'csvfile':
121  csv-file csv file listing the mrt data to read (default: not-set)
122 
123  Data interface options for 'sqlite':
124  db-file sqlite database (default: not-set)
125 
126  Data interface options for 'mysql':
127  db-name name of the mysql database to use (default: bgparchive)
128  db-user mysql username to use (default: bgpstream)
129  db-password mysql password to use (default: not-set)
130  db-host hostname/IP of the mysql server (default: not-set)
131  db-port port of the mysql server (default: not-set)
132  db-socket Unix socket of the mysql server (default: not-set)
133  ris-path Prefix path of RIS data (default: not-set)
134  rv-path prefix path of RouteViews data (default: not-set)
135 
136 
137 Example:
138 
139 print out all the bgp elems observed in the
140 *routeviews.route-views.jinx.updates.1427846400.bz2* file from
141 00:00:15 to 00:01:30
142 
143 
144  $ bgpreader -dsinglefile -oupd-file,./test/routeviews.route-views.jinx.updates.1427846400.bz2 -W1427846415,1427846490 -e
145 
146  1427846430|196.223.14.55|30844|W|185.75.149.0/24|||||
147  1427846430|196.223.14.55|30844|W|103.47.62.0/23|||||
148  1427846430|196.223.14.55|30844|W|132.8.48.0/20|||||
149  1427846430|196.223.14.55|30844|W|132.8.64.0/18|||||
150  1427846430|196.223.14.55|30844|W|132.22.0.0/16|||||
151  1427846430|196.223.14.55|30844|W|131.34.0.0/16|||||
152  1427846430|196.223.14.55|30844|W|129.54.0.0/16|||||
153  1427846430|196.223.14.55|30844|A|41.159.135.0/24|196.223.14.55|30844 6939 12956 6713 16058|16058||
154  1427846430|196.223.14.55|30844|A|84.205.73.0/24|196.223.14.55|30844 6939 12654|12654||
155 
156 
157 
158 bgpstream C library tutorial {#tutorial}
159 =====================
160 
161 Below is a simple example that shows how to use most of the C library
162 API functions. The example is fully functioning and it can be run within the *test*
163 folder included in the distribution.
164 
165  $ cd bgpstream-1.0.0/test
166  $ gcc ./tutorial.c -lbgpstream -o ./tutorial
167  $ ./tutorial
168  Read 1544 elems
169 
170 
171 The program reads information from the example sqlite
172 database provided with the distribution and it counts the elems that match
173 the filters (collectors, record type, and time).
174 
175 
176 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~{.c}
177 #include <stdio.h>
178 #include <time.h>
179 #include <unistd.h>
180 #include <fcntl.h>
181 #include <stdlib.h>
182 #include <netinet/in.h>
183 #include <sys/socket.h>
184 #include <arpa/inet.h>
185 #include <stdbool.h>
186 #include <string.h>
187 
188 #include "bgpstream.h"
189 
190 int
191 main()
192 {
193  /* Allocate memory for a bgpstream instance */
194  bgpstream_t *bs = bs = bgpstream_create();
195  if(!bs) {
196  fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Could not create BGPStream instance\n");
197  return -1;
198  }
199 
200  /* Allocate memory for a re-usable bgprecord instance */
201  bgpstream_record_t *bs_record = bgpstream_record_create();
202  if(bs_record == NULL)
203  {
204  fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Could not create BGPStream record\n");
205  return -1;
206  }
207 
208 
209  /* Configure the sqlite interface */
210  bgpstream_data_interface_id_t datasource_id = bgpstream_get_data_interface_id_by_name(bs, "sqlite");
211  bgpstream_set_data_interface(bs, datasource_id);
212 
213  /* Configure the sqlite interface options */
214  bgpstream_data_interface_option_t *option =
215  bgpstream_get_data_interface_option_by_name(bs, datasource_id,
216  "db-file");
217  bgpstream_set_data_interface_option(bs, option, "./sqlite_test.db");
218 
219  /* Select bgp data from RRC06 and route-views.jinx collectors only */
220  bgpstream_add_filter(bs, BGPSTREAM_FILTER_TYPE_COLLECTOR, "rrc06");
221  bgpstream_add_filter(bs, BGPSTREAM_FILTER_TYPE_COLLECTOR, "route-views.jinx");
222 
223  /* Process updates only */
224  bgpstream_add_filter(bs, BGPSTREAM_FILTER_TYPE_RECORD_TYPE, "updates");
225 
226  /* Select a time interval to process:
227  * Wed, 01 Apr 2015 00:02:30 GMT -> Wed, 01 Apr 2015 00:05:00 UTC */
228  bgpstream_add_interval_filter(bs,1427846550,1427846700);
229 
230  /* Start bgpstream */
231  if(bgpstream_start(bs) < 0) {
232  fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Could not init BGPStream\n");
233  return -1;
234  }
235 
236  int get_next_ret = 0;
237  int elem_counter = 0;
238 
239  /* pointer to a bgpstream elem, memory is borrowed from bgpstream,
240  * use the elem_copy function to own the memory */
241  bgpstream_elem_t *bs_elem = NULL;
242 
243  /* Read the stream of records */
244  do
245  {
246  /* get next record */
247  get_next_ret = bgpstream_get_next_record(bs, bs_record);
248  if(get_next_ret && bs_record->status == BGPSTREAM_RECORD_STATUS_VALID_RECORD)
249  {
250  while((bs_elem = bgpstream_record_get_next_elem (bs_record)) != NULL)
251  {
252  elem_counter++;
253  }
254  }
255  }
256  while(get_next_ret > 0);
257 
258  printf("\tRead %d elems\n", elem_counter);
259 
260  /* de-allocate memory for the bgpstream */
261  bgpstream_destroy(bs);
262 
263  /* de-allocate memory for the bgpstream record */
264  bgpstream_record_destroy(bs_record);
265 
266 
267  return 0;
268 }
269 
270 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
271 
272 
273 Documentation {#docs}
274 =============
275 This online [BGP Stream API] is currently the best source of information
276 about using BGP Stream, please take a look at the installed headers:
277 
278 - **bgpstream.h**
279 - **bgpstream_record.h**
280 - **bgpstream_elem.h**
281 
282 <!---
283 This online [BGP Stream Documentation](TODO) is the best source of information
284 about using BGP Stream. It contains full API documentation, usage instructions
285 for the BGP Stream tools. It also has tutorials about using the libbgpstream
286 library to perform analysis of BGP data.
287 -->
